subject: Head, Directorate of Operati
body:
Head, Directorate of Operations
Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN)
Re: Final Payment Reconciliation
Attention: Beneficiary
This is to inform you that your payment file has been re-visited and
reconciled in-line with the new contract/inheritance payment
reformation guideline, and thus confirmed you are the beneficiary of
inheritance proceeds with accrued interest in the tune of
$10,500,000.00 United States Dollars.
We have discovered with dismay that corrupt officials trying to divert
your fund into their private accounts have unnecessarily delayed your
payment since 2010. Hence, to forestall security on your fund, we have
arranged your payment locally through our Swift Card payment with
UNITED BANK OF AFRICA. We have organized a personal identification
number (PIN) ATM Debit Card, as this will enable only you to have
direct control of your $10,500,000.00 United States Dollars. We have
set-up an investigation machinery to monitor the process to avoid
repetition of the hopeless situations created in the past by corrupt
officials.
Based on the latest payment arrangement, your payment had been gazette
to be pay to you via ATM Debit Card. By this process, an ATM Card will
be issue on your name and your $10,500,000.00 United States Dollars
will be loaded into it and delivered to your postal/mailing address
with activation instructions that will enable you to activate the card
and withdraw money from any Bank ATM worldwide.
You are hereby advised to contact the Swift Card payment center of the
UNITED BANK OF AFRICA to conclude the delivery arrangement of your
card to your address as instruction has been forward to them.  Note
that we have chosen UNITED BANK OF AFRICA to pay your fund because
they have a global payments technology that enables consumers,
businesses, financial institutions and the government to use digital
currency instead of cash and cheques.
Contact UNITED BANK OF AFRICA Swift Card payment center with the below
contact details
CONTACT PERSON: MR.VICTOR FAMUYIBO
DIRECTOR, SWIFT CARD PAYMENTS UNITED BANK OF AFRICA
14 FLOOR 51/55 BROAD STREET LAGOS NIGERIA
CONTACT EMAIL: 
vicfam_dg67@outlook.com
Also for your security, you are to stop further communication with any
other person(s) to avoid any hitches/lapses again receiving your
payment. Note that because of impostors, we hereby issued you a code
of conduct, which is (ATM-0242). You will indicate this code when
contacting the Swift Card payment center using it as your subject.
Thank you and do contact the Swift Card payment center now.
 
Yours faithfully,
Jane Lydia Williams (MRS)
Head, Directorate of Operations
Contract/inheritance payments & settlement
Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN)

subject: Re:   Head, Directorate of Operati
body:
Dear Jane Lydia Williams,

Thank you for your email and the information provided. I am glad to hear that my payment file has been reconciled and that I am the beneficiary of such a substantial amount.

I understand from your email that an ATM Debit Card will be issued in my name, loaded with the funds, and delivered to my postal address. This is indeed a convenient method of payment.

However, before proceeding further, I would like to clarify a few points:

1. Could you please provide more details about the process of activating the card once it is received?
2. Are there any fees associated with this service that I should be aware of?
3. How long can I expect it to take for the card to arrive at my address?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Tracie
